Frequently Asked Questions / Staff Policy

Are all employees really the same person? ▼
Yes. HR has been informed. HR is also Mortimer. He filed a complaint against himself, then approved it, then lost the paperwork in a spectral filing cabinet that only manifests on Tuesdays.
Why does the founder keep dying? ▼
Mortimer I was a wizard — technically still is, though his license was revoked posthumously in 1903, 1952, 1987, and 2019. Every attempt to permanently die has resulted in an accidental self-necromancy. The Bureau of Spectral Affairs has issued a formal "please stop" letter.
Can I request a specific Mortimer for my service? ▼
You may express a preference on Form MRT-7B ("Mortimer Selection Request"). However, they often swap shifts without telling anyone, and since they all look identical — translucent, vaguely confused, wearing the same robe — most clients cannot tell the difference.
Is the cat funeral case real? ▼
Case MRT-2024-0445 is ongoing. The cat (unnamed, approx. 14 lbs) was brought in by a woman who paid $4,200 in cash and left no contact information. The casket is mahogany. The haunting began 48 hours post-burial. Mortimer IV says the cat "has opinions."
What is "Abstract Internment"? ▼
A service offered exclusively by Mortimer I, who insists he can bury intangible concepts. Past clients have interred: one (1) childhood memory, the entire month of February 2016, and "the feeling you get when you walk into a room and forget why." Success rates vary. Refund policy: no.
Why does logging in require a blood oath? ▼
Mortimer IV (IT) says this is "standard two-factor authentication." We have asked him to reconsider. He has declined. The alternative login method involves a riddle spoken into a mirror at midnight, which we feel is less convenient but arguably more secure.
Mortimer & Mortimer & Mortimer & Mortimer Funeral Services is a registered spectral enterprise operating under provisional license MRT-1847-REC. All staff are the same person. This is not a tax dodge; it is a curse. We are required by the Incorporeal Commerce Bureau to disclose that 100% of our workforce is deceased. Customer deposits are held in a non-haunted escrow account (allegedly).

If you are reading this, you are either staff or lost. In either case: we're sorry.
